entries: When the acrobat rolls a success on an {@skill Acrobatics} check, they get a critical success instead. They aren't {@condition flat-footed} when attempting to {@action Balance} and can attempt an {@skill Acrobatics} check instead of a Reflex save to {@action Grab an Edge}.
top.name: Steady Balance

entries: The acrobat treats all falls as 50 feet shorter.
mid.name: Cat Fall

mid.trigger: The acrobat is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see
entries: The acrobat gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: The acrobat deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The acrobat swings on a rope or trapeze, moving up to double their Speed. At any point during the swing, they can make a melee {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Swinging Strike

entries: The adept focuses inward to muster knowledge and wisdom. While in this state of concentration, they gain a +2 status bonus to checks to {@action Recall Knowledge}, but take a –2 penalty to {@skill Perception}. They can end their focused state with a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
top.name: Focused Thinker

entries: An advisor is well versed in soothing agitated nobles. Their calming voice gives them a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Deception} and {@skill Diplomacy} checks when dealing with members of the nobility.
top.name: Placate

mid.trigger: An enemy within 15 feet damages the antipaladin
entries: The antipaladin increases the amount of damage they take by {@dice 2d6} and deals {@dice 2d6} damage to the triggering enemy, choosing evil or negative damage. In addition, the antipaladin deals 2 extra damage of the chosen type with their {@action Strike||Strikes} against the triggering creature until the end of the antipaladin's next turn.
mid.name: Destructive Vengeance

entries: The antipaladin makes a melee {@action Strike}. If they hit and deal damage, the target is {@condition frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened 2} on a critical hit.
bot.name: Intimidating Strike

attacks.name: acid flask
attacks.damage: 1 acid plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid} and 1 {@trait splash} acid

entries: The apothecary can identify the effect of any alchemical composition or medical ingredient using only their senses. This typically takes 1 minute.
top.name: Medical Wisdom

bot.requirements: A direct superior is supervising the apprentice
entries: The apprentice gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and skill checks until the end of their next turn.
bot.name: Apprentice's Ambition

entries: The archer sentry aims carefully and fires. They make a ranged weapon {@action Strike} with a +1 circumstance bonus. The {@action Strike} ignores the {@condition concealed} condition, lesser cover, and standard cover, and reduces greater cover to standard cover.
bot.name: Sentry's Aim

creature.name: Assassin
items: simple injury poison (8 doses, {@damage 2d4} poison damage)

entries: The assassin can move their full Speed when Sneaking.
top.name: Swift Sneak

entries: The assassin isn't {@condition flat-footed} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.
mid.name: Deny Advantage

mid.trigger: The assassin is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see
entries: The assassin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

bot.requirements: The assassin is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand
entries: The assassin applies a poison to the weapon.
bot.name: Poison Weapon

entries: The assassin Interacts to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.
bot.name: Quick Draw

entries: The assassin deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are flatfooted to the assassin.
bot.name: Surprise Attack

entries: If the astronomer is able to see the night sky, they can {@action Sense Direction} using a +10 modifier.
top.name: Living Sextant

mid.trigger: A creature {@action Cast a Spell||Casts a Spell} the astronomer has prepared
entries: The astronomer expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The astronomer loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The astronomer then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.
mid.name: Counterspell

entries: When the bandit rolls initiative using {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth}, they can attempt to {@action Demoralize} one creature as a free action.
mid.name: Bandit's Ambush

entries: {@condition Frightened} creatures are {@condition flat-footed} to the bandit.
bot.name: Dread Striker

entries: The bandit ignores the effects of non-magical {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} in forests.
bot.name: Favored Terrain

entries: The barkeep has been in enough bar fights to know how to throw a few punches. When fighting in their bar and making a nonlethal attack, the barkeep gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls and deals an additional {@dice 1d4} damage.
bot.name: Bar Brawler

entries: The barkeep gives some pertinent advice to a single creature other than themself. For 24 hours, when that creature fails a skill check or saving throw, they can recall this advice and reroll the check, using the second result instead. Once that creature uses this ability, its effect ends. A creature that receives the Barkeep's Advice is temporarily immune to the ability for 1 month.
bot.name: Barkeep's Advice

entries: +9 Str +0, Dex +1, Con +1, Int +3, Wis +2, Cha + 4 Items court garb (functions as fine clothing), law book (functions as scholarly journal), writing set.
top.name: Society

entries: A barrister gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Diplomacy} checks to {@action Make an Impression} or {@action Request} something of the deciding members within a courtroom. If the barrister successfully Performs against a DC of 20 during the 20 minutes prior to the check, they increase the circumstance bonus to +4.
top.name: Sway the Judge and Jury

entries: The barrister uses existing case law to undermine their opposition. If they succeed at a {@dc 20} {@skill Lore||Legal Lore} check, they impose a –2 circumstance penalty on the next {@skill Diplomacy} check an opponent attempts in a legal argument. Any further attempts to Cite Precedent fail until a new topic with different precedents is being argued.
bot.name: Cite Precedent

entries: The beast tamer can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple {@action Request||Requests} of them.
top.name: Wild Empathy

entries: The beast tamer fights alongside a trained animal ally of its level or lower, most likely a {@creature tiger}. The animal has the standard number of actions, uses its normal stat block, and counts toward the encounter's XP budget normally.

The beast tamer can spend 1 action to gain the support benefit appropriate to its {@filter trained animal|companionsfamiliars||type=companion}. Unlike for an animal companion, this doesn't require the animal to use any of its actions.
bot.name: Trained Animal

entries: The beggar Strides three times and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC during those actions.
bot.name: Beat a Retreat

entries: The bodyguard selects one creature they can see and hear within 30 feet. That creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as the bodyguard is adjacent to the chosen creature and can act; this bonus lasts until the start of the bodyguard's next turn.
bot.name: Bodyguard's Defense

entries: The bosun orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the bosun's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.
bot.name: Bosun's Command

entries: The bosun {@action Strike||Strikes} with their naval pike.

If this {@action Strike} hits, the bosun can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist {@action Strike} against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the fist {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pike and Strike

entries: The bounty hunter designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're {@action Track||Tracking}, as their prey. The bounty hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} the prey and to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track} the prey. This effect lasts until the bounty hunter uses {@action Hunt Prey} again.
bot.name: Hunt Prey

entries: The bounty hunter {@action Stride}, {@action Step||Steps}, or {@action Sneak||Sneaks}, and then Interacts to reload.
bot.name: Running Reload

entries: The first time the bounty hunter hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal an additional {@damage 1d8} precision damage.
bot.name: Precision Edge

entries: The burglar isn't {@condition flat-footed} to creatures of 4th level or lower that are {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.
mid.name: Deny Advantage

mid.trigger: The burglar is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see
entries: The burglar gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: When the burglar {@action Stride||Strides} half their Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.
bot.name: Mobility

entries: The burglar deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to flatfooted creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: On the first round of combat, if the burglar rolls {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth} for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are {@condition flat-footed} to them.
bot.name: Surprise Attack

entries: 30 feet. The captain of the guard bolsters lower-level guards under their command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to their Will saves.
mid.name: Aura of Command

entries: When the captain of the guard rolls a success on a Will save against a {@trait fear} effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the {@condition frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
mid.name: Bravery

entries: When the captain has their shield raised, they can {@feat Shield Block} when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of the captain.
mid.name: Shield Warden

bot.requirements: The captain of the guard has their shield raised
entries: The captain of the guard presses forward, using their shield to push back foes. The captain {@action Stride||Strides} and Shoves, in either order. The multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Shove}, though the {@action Shove} does count toward the captain's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Shielded Advance

entries: The charlatan can use {@skill Performance} instead of {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} and instead of {@skill Intimidation} to {@action Demoralize}. They can also use an acting {@skill Performance} instead of {@skill Deception} to {@action Impersonate}.
top.name: Versatile Performance

entries: The charlatan deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The chronicler reduces their {@condition dying} condition by 1. If the chronicler is no longer {@condition dying}, they remain {@condition unconscious} for at least 1 hour or until they regain 1 Hit Point.
mid.name: Live to Tell the Tale

entries: The chronicler can activate any scroll of a 2nd-level spell or lower as if they had the spell on their spell list, regardless of its magical tradition.
bot.name: Scroll Mastery

lore.note: any one related to their trade

entries: When three or more commoners are adjacent to each other, each commoner gets a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletic checks to {@action Shove}, attack rolls, and damage rolls.
bot.name: Power of the Mob

mid.trigger: The cult leader is targeted with an attack, and a lower-ranking cultist is adjacent to them
entries: The cult leader orders their cultist to leap in front of the attack. The cultist and cult leader swap places, and the cultist becomes the target of the attack. If the cultist has Fanatical Frenzy or a similar ability, they can activate it as a reaction if they take damage from the triggering attack.
mid.name: Protect the Master!

entries: With a short emotional phrase, the cult leader tries to sway the public to do their bidding. The cult leader tries to convince up to four bystanders in a crowd to either cause a commotion, turn against a person or group, leave the area, protect the cult leader, or calm down. The cult leader attempts a single {@skill Deception} check against the highest {@skill Perception} DC among the targets.

entries.Critical Success: The targets believe the lie and act as directed for 1 minute. Additionally, one bystander remains by the cult leader's side, influenced enough to join their sect. All other targets become wise to the cult leader after 1 minute, at which point their attitude toward the leader worsens by one step.
entries.Success: As a critical success, but no bystander joins the sect permanently.
entries.Critical Failure: The crowd is unmoved and unamused, and their attitude toward the cult leader worsens by one step.

bot.name: Gather Converts

cult lore.note: applies to the cultist's own cult

bot.requirements: The cultist has taken damage and is neither {@condition fatigued} nor already in a frenzy
entries: The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is {@condition fatigued}.
bot.name: Fanatical Frenzy

entries: The dancer {@action Stride||Strides} up to their Speed. Once during this movement, when the dancer is adjacent to a creature, the dancer can make that creature attempt a {@dc 17} Will save. On a failure, that creature is {@condition fascinated} with the dancer until the end of its next turn.
bot.name: Fascinating Dance

entries: Demonic study has garnered the attention of at least one demon that is actively trying to possess the demonologist. When the demonologist publicly espouses the benefits of demonic power (whether they believe it a good thing or not), they gain a +1 status bonus to skill checks, AC, and saves for 1 day. These bonuses don't apply against demons.
At the end of the day, the demonologist must attempt a {@dc 20} Will save, becoming possessed for 1 day on a failure (permanently on a critical failure).
top.name: Abyssal Temptation

bot.requirements: The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell
entries: The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Abyss into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage. Roll {@dice 1d20} to determine the type: 1–7 acid, 8–9 cold, 10–11 electricity, 12–18 fire, 19–20 negative.
bot.name: Breach the Abyss

entries: The demonologist can cast a 5th-level {@spell summon fiend} arcane spell to summon a demon. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-level prepared spells and voluntarily take {@damage 4d12} mental damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the demonologist is unable to {@action Sustain a Spell||Sustain the Spell}, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a DC {@flatDC 10} flat check each round, ending the spell on a failure.
bot.name: Demon Summoning

entries: Any creature deceived by the despot's {@skill Deception} skill believes the deception more readily on the next day. Any attempts to later attempt a {@skill Perception} check against the despot's {@skill Deception} DC take a –2 circumstance penalty, as do other creatures' attempts to convince the creature otherwise, such as through {@skill Diplomacy} or further {@skill Deception}.
top.name: Persistent Lies

entries: When the despot casts a bloodline spell, enthrall, flaming sphere, or charm, either a target takes 1 fire damage per spell level, or the despot gains a +1 status bonus to {@skill Deception} checks for 1 round.
bot.name: Bloodline Magic

entries: When the despot {@action Cast a Spell||Casts a Spell} from a spell slot, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, the despot gains a status bonus equal to the spell's level to that spell's damage.
bot.name: Dangerous Sorcery

bot.requirements: The dockhand is adjacent to a crate
entries: The dockhand picks up a crate and heaves it up to 15 feet. Upon landing, the crate breaks open in a 5-foot burst. Each creature within the area takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage ({@dc 13} basic Reflex save), and the area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} until cleared.
bot.name: Heft Crate

entries: The dockhand Interacts to either draw a bottle of alcohol or pick up a nearby unattended bottle of alcohol and drink the whole thing. For 1 minute, the dockhand gains a +2 item bonus to melee damage rolls and saving throws against fear, but they become {@condition clumsy 1}.
bot.name: Swig

bot.requirements: The drunkard is drunk, and isn't {@condition fatigued} or raging
entries: Something sets the drunkard off, causing them to fly into a drunken rage. They gain 6 temporary Hit Points that last until the drunken rage ends. While raging, they deal 4 additional damage with melee attacks and take a –1 penalty to AC. The drunkard can't use concentrate actions except {@action Seek} and {@trait rage} actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the drunkard falls {@condition unconscious} or sobers up. The drunkard can't voluntarily stop the Drunken Rage. Once the rage ends, the drunkard can't {@action Rage} again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Drunken Rage

bot.requirements: The executioner is adjacent to a {@condition dying} creature or a creature specifically prepared for a killing blow
entries: The executioner {@action Strike||Strikes} the creature with their greataxe. On a hit, in addition to taking damage, the target must attempt a Fortitude save or be reduced to 0 HP and become {@condition dying 1}. If the creature was already {@condition dying} (including if it was reduced to 0 HP by the {@action Strike}'s damage), the creature's {@condition dying} value increases by 1, in addition to any increase from the {@action Strike}. On a critical failure, the creature dies instantly. If the executioner's {@action Strike} was a critical hit, the target uses the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of their saving throw.
bot.name: Behead

entries: The executioner makes a melee {@action Strike}. If it hits and deals damage, the target is {@condition frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened 2} on a critical hit.

Mark for Death {@as 1} (concentrate) The executioner marks a single creature they can see for death. The first time each round the executioner {@action Strike||Strikes} that creature, the {@action Strike} deals {@dice 1d12} additional precision damage. The creature remains marked for death until the executioner is knocked out, marks a different creature for death, or the encounter ends.
bot.name: Intimidating Strike

creature.name: False Priest
items: alchemical tools (used as "blessed items" to fool marks)

entries: On the first round of combat, if the false priest rolls {@skill Deception} or {@skill Performance} for initiative, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the false priest.
bot.name: Deceiver's Surprise

entries: The false priest convinces someone of their omnipotence by attempting a {@skill Deception} check compared to the creature's Will DC. If successful, the target gains {@dice 1d8+4} temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour or until the false priest removes them by rebuking the target, whichever occurs first.
bot.name: Fickle Prophecy

entries: The false priest deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures. This increases to {@dice 2d6} against creatures {@condition flat-footed} due to the false priest's {@action Feint} or deceiver's surprise.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

bot.trigger: The false priest critically fails a {@skill Deception} or {@skill Performance} check
entries: The false priest {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: The Jig Is Up

bot.requirements: The farmer's last action was a successful pitchfork {@action Strike}
entries: The farmer moves the creature they hit with their pitchfork up to 5 feet, and the target falls {@condition prone}. The target can attempt a {@dc 13} Reflex save to avoid falling {@condition prone}, and avoids being moved altogether on a critical success.
bot.name: Pitch Bale

entries: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} to identify an item's value and {@action Identify Magic} on an item.

They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} checks when doing so, and to {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.
top.name: Fence's Eye

entries: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence Interacts to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then {@action Strike||Strikes} with the weapon or {@action Activate an Item||Activates the Item}.
bot.name: Quick Rummage

entries: When the fence successfully {@action Feint||Feints}, their target is {@condition flat-footed} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.
bot.name: Scoundrel's Feint

entries: The fence deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The gang leader isn't {@condition flat-footed} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.
mid.name: Deny Advantage

entries: When the gang leader rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.
mid.name: Evasion

entries: On the first round of combat, if the gang leader rolls {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth} for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are {@condition flat-footed} to the gang leader.
mid.name: Surprise Attack

mid.trigger: The gang leader is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see
entries: The gang leader gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

bot.trigger: The gang leader rolls a critical hit against a creature
entries: All allies that can see the gang leader gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the gang leader's next turn.
bot.name: Brutal Rally

entries: Any enemy is {@condition flat-footed} against the gang leader's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the gang leader and one of the gang leader's allies.
bot.name: Gang Up

entries: The gang leader Interacts to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.
bot.name: Quick Draw

entries: The gang leader deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A grave robber carries the following infused items: 2 lesser bottled lightnings, a lesser frost vial, and a lesser thunderstone. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time the grave robber makes their daily preparations.
top.name: Infused Items

bot.requirements: The gravedigger holds a bull's-eye lantern in one hand and their religious symbol in the other, and the lantern contains oil
entries: The gravedigger recites a brief chant to ignite their lantern with positive energy. Each undead creature in a 15-foot line takes {@damage 3d6} positive damage ({@dc 14} basic Fortitude save). This action uses all remaining oil in the bull's-eye lantern.
bot.name: Light in the Dark

mid.trigger: The guide is about to roll a {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} check to determine their initiative
entries: The guide visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how the guide warns allies, this action has the {@trait auditory} or {@trait visual} trait.
mid.name: Guide's Warning

entries: The guide points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet.

The guide and all allies that can hear or see the guide gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of the guide's next turn. The guide adds an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to their weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.
bot.name: Guiding Words

entries: The guildmaster gives a speech to inspire themself and all guild-member allies within 60 feet, granting them a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the guildmaster's next turn.
bot.name: Call to Action

entries: While within the guild or presiding over guild business, the guildmaster gains a +2 circumstance bonus to weapon attack rolls and deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage on a successful weapon attack.
bot.name: Sworn Duty

entries: Whenever the harbormaster rolls a success on a check to {@action Balance}, they get a critical success instead. They're not {@condition flat-footed} while Balancing on narrow surfaces and uneven ground. They can attempt an {@skill Acrobatics} check instead of a Reflex save to {@action Grab an Edge}.
top.name: Steady Balance

entries: The harbormaster has endured their share of adverse conditions at sea. Any creature that's in adverse weather or aboard a vessel on rough water is {@condition flat-footed} to the harbormaster.
bot.name: Experienced Hand

entries: While harrow readers try to avoid combat, no throw of the cards can avoid fate, so a harrow reader learns how to best survive. In the harrow reader's first encounter each day, they gain a +1 status bonus to their initiative roll, their attack rolls, and their AC.
bot.name: Fated Doom

entries: While using {@skill Survival} to {@action Subsist}, if the hunter rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the hunter rolls a success, they can provide food for 16 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 32 creatures on a critical success.
top.name: Forager

entries: The hunter ignores the effects of {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} from a forest environment. They can {@action Sneak} through underbrush without the need to attempt a {@skill Stealth} check as long as the hunter moves no more than 5 feet at a time and is not within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during their movement.
top.name: Forest Walker

entries: As poacher, but for {@damage 1d8} precision damage.
bot.name: Hunt Prey
entries_as_xyz: The poacher designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're {@action Track||Tracking}, as their prey. The poacher gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} the prey and to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track} the prey.

The first time the poacher hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional {@damage 1d8} precision damage. The poacher also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the poacher uses {@action Hunt Prey} again.

entries: The inkeeper's business gives them insight into the neighborhood's happenings. When {@action Gather Information||Gathering Information}, a person can gain as much information chatting with the innkeeper for 30 minutes to an hour as they would gain from 2 hours spent canvassing the neighborhood. Each person can learn gossip from an innkeeper only once per day, and only if the innkeeper is {@condition friendly} or {@condition helpful} to that individual. Whatever information the innkeeper knows about a given topic doesn't change if someone else asks the innkeeper about that topic, unless the innkeeper has since learned more.
top.name: Font of Gossip

entries: An innkeeper gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and AC within their inn.
bot.name: Home Turf

bot.requirements: The jailer has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature
entries: The jailer attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If the jailer succeeds at an attack roll with a +9 modifier against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.
bot.name: Efficient Capture

entries: The jailer makes a melee {@action Strike}. If it hits and deals damage, the target is {@condition frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened 2} on a critical hit.
bot.name: Intimidating Strike

entries: The jailer doesn't take the normal penalty for making a nonlethal attack when attacking with their club.
bot.name: Subdue Prisoners

entries: When the judge Makes an Impression, they can compare their {@skill Diplomacy} check result to the Will DCs of up to four targets instead of one.
top.name: Group Impression

entries: When Searching through stacks of books, a librarian can find the answer to almost any question. This allows the librarian to use {@skill Lore||Library Lore} in place of other lore skills, given enough time. The GM determines the DC of the check and the amount of time it takes (typically, a librarian can attempt three or four checks during 1 day of downtime).
top.name: Methodical Research

entries: 1 Focus Point, {@dc 20}; 2nd diviner's sight (Core Rulebook 406)
bot.name: Wizard School Spell

entries: The mastermind can use {@skill Performance} instead of {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} and instead of {@skill Intimidation} to {@action Demoralize}. The mastermind can also use an acting {@skill Performance} instead of {@skill Deception} to {@action Impersonate}.
top.name: Versatile Performance

entries: When the mastermind successfully {@action Feint||Feints}, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against the mastermind's melee attacks until the end of the mastermind's next turn. On a critical success, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against all melee attacks for that time, not just the mastermind's.
bot.name: Scoundrel's Feint

entries: The mastermind deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The merchant can use {@skill Lore||Mercantile Lore} to {@action Recall Knowledge} about items, including determining their value. They can also attempt to {@action Identify Magic} using.
top.name: Appraising Eye

entries: {@skill Lore} and can do so without first knowing whether the item is magical.
top.name: Mercantile

bot.requirements: The miner has their hammer in hand
entries: The miner Interacts to draw a piton, then hammers it into a creature to pin them in place, attempting an {@skill Athletics} check against the target's Reflex DC. On a hit, the target is {@condition immobilized} until it removes the piton with a successful {@dc 10} {@skill Athletics} check made as an {@action Interact} action.
bot.name: Piton Pin

bot.requirements: The monster hunter isn't {@condition fatigued} or raging
entries: The monster hunter gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, they deal 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gain a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed, and take a –1 penalty to AC. The monster hunter can't use concentrate actions except {@action Seek} and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies the monster hunter can perceive, or until the monster hunter falls {@condition unconscious}. Once the rage ends, the monster hunter can't {@action Rage} again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Rage

entries: The monster hunter {@action Stride||Strides} twice and makes a melee {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Sudden Charge

entries: {@skill Lore} check, the navigator plots an optimal course. The severity of environmental conditions other than temperature are reduced by one step for 24 hours (two steps on a critical success). This changes moderate damage to minor damage, winds that create {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} cause only {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}, and so on.
top.name: Sailing

entries: The navigator deals an additional {@damage 1d6} weapon damage when on a ship.
bot.name: Navigator's Edge

entries: The necromancer emits a scent of putrid rot in a 5-foot emanation. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura is {@condition sickened 1}.
top.name: Stench of Decay

bot.requirements: The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn
entries: The necromancer expends the power stored in their mace. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.
bot.name: Drain Bonded Item

entries: After years of sticking their nose where it doesn't belong, the noble has learned to read lips from afar, with the effects of the Lip Reader feat (Core Rulebook 265).
top.name: Lip Reader

entries: The noble {@action Feint||Feints}. On a success, the noble {@action Strike||Strikes} the target.
bot.name: Noble's Ruse

entries: The noble deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: Ever loyal, the palace guard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls when defending their liege.
bot.name: Royal Defender

entries: A physician has a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Diplomacy} checks to {@action Make an Impression} on or make a {@action Request} of a diseased, poisoned, or {@condition wounded} creature.
top.name: Bedside Manner

entries: When the physician rolls a critical failure on a check to {@action Treat Disease}, Treat.
top.name: Doctor's Hand

entries: Wounds, they get a failure instead.
top.name: Poison, or Treat

entries: +8 Str +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int +0, Wis +2, Cha + 2 Items cutlass (functions as a scimitar), dagger, padded armor.
top.name: Lore

entries: When the pirate rolls a success on a Will save against a {@trait fear} effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime they gain the {@condition frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
mid.name: Bravery

entries: The pirate swings on a rope or {@action Stride||Strides}, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee {@action Strike} at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.
bot.name: Boarding Action

entries: When the plague doctor casts heal, they roll d10s instead of d8s.
bot.name: Healing Hands

entries: When the plague doctor casts heal targeting a single creature, the plague doctor also restores Hit Points equal to the spell's level to themself or any other creature within range of the spell.
bot.name: Improved Communal Healing

entries: While using {@skill Survival} to {@action Subsist}, if the hunter rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the hunter rolls a success, they can provide food for 4 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 8 creatures on a critical success.
top.name: Forager

entries: The poacher can use the {@skill Crafting} skill to create the following snares: alarm snare, hampering snare, marking snare, and signaling snare. The poacher can create four snares each day without paying for the materials, using 3 {@action Interact} actions to set up each snare.
top.name: Snare Crafting

entries: The poacher designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're {@action Track||Tracking}, as their prey. The poacher gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} the prey and to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track} the prey.

The first time the poacher hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional {@damage 1d8} precision damage. The poacher also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the poacher uses {@action Hunt Prey} again.
bot.name: Hunt Prey

entries: When the priest casts heal, they roll d10s instead of d8s.
bot.name: Healing Hands

entries: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the priest's spellcasting action, the priest attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If the priest succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.
bot.name: Steady Spellcasting

entries: The prisoner deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the prisoner.
bot.name: Surprise Attack

bot.trigger: The prisoner reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points
entries: The prisoner attempts an {@skill Intimidation} check with a +2 circumstance bonus to {@action Demoralize} a single creature it can see and that can see them.
bot.name: You're Next

creature.name: Prophet
items: {@item flail}, manifesto (functions as {@item religious text}), pouch of rocks, robes

entries: +12, {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} +13 Str +1, Dex +4, Con +5, Int +5, Wis +2, Cha –1 Items alchemist's tools, moderate antidote, moderate antiplague, bandolier, +1 sickle, work coat (functions as padded armor)
top.name: Stealth

entries: A reckless scientist carries the following infused items: 2 moderate acid flasks, 2 moderate alchemist's fires, 1 lesser bomber's eye elixir, 2 moderate frost vials, and 3 lesser elixirs of life. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time the scientist makes their daily preparations.
top.name: Infused Items

entries: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the reckless scientist, one of the scientist's poorly stowed alchemical items bursts. The GM determines the item randomly. If it was a bomb, the alchemist takes damage from the bomb, and any creature adjacent to the alchemist takes the {@trait splash} damage. Any other item is simply wasted.
mid.name: Unstable Compounds

entries: The reckless scientist Interacts to draw a bomb, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with it.
bot.name: Quick Bomber

bot.requirements: The reckless scientist is holding a bomb or elixir
entries: The reckless scientist combines the bomb with another bomb or the elixir with another elixir. They can {@action Interact} to draw a second bomb or elixir if necessary as part of this action. They attempt a {@dc 28} {@skill Crafting} check, destroying both component items to create one new item. If a viable resulting item isn't used by the end of the scientist's next turn, it explodes as described under critical failure.

entries.Critical Success: The new item has the full effect of both component items when used.
entries.Success: The new item combines both items, but halves the effect of each. (This halves damage for bombs, the amount of healing of elixirs of life, or the duration for effects that can't have their value halved. Details are determined by the GM.)
entries.Critical Failure: The new item immediately explodes, dealing {@damage 3d6} piercing damage to the reckless scientist.

bot.name: Reckless Alchemy

entries: The ruffian's brutality shakes foes' confidence. When the ruffian deals damage on a critical hit, the target is {@condition frightened 1}, and the ruffian can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is {@quickref forced movement||3|forced movement}).
bot.name: Brutal Beating

bot.trigger: The ruffian has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand
entries: The ruffian makes a melee {@action Strike} while keeping one hand free. If this {@action Strike} hits, the target is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the ruffian's reach, whichever comes first.
bot.name: Snagging Strike

entries: The ruffian deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The saboteur can {@action Craft} snares and has the supplies to make up to two caltrop snares and up to two hampering snares.
top.name: Snare Crafting

entries: The saboteur deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

mid.trigger: An ally is about to attempt an attack roll or skill check and has not yet rolled
entries: The sage gives the ally a savvy piece of advice, providing valuable insight. The ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering roll.
mid.name: Timely Advice

entries: The sage studies a creature, attempting an {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Occultism}, {@skill Religion}, or {@skill Society} check against the creature's {@action Recall Knowledge} DC. On a success, the sage gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls and AC against that creature and deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage to the creature with weapon attacks. These benefits last for 1 minute or until the sage uses this ability again.
bot.name: Sage's Analysis

mid.trigger: An object that the server could hold in one hand is dropped within the server's reach
mid.requirements: The server has at least one hand free
entries: The server catches the dropped object before it hits the floor or leaves their reach.
mid.name: Quick Catch

entries: When the ship captain rolls a success on a Will save against a {@trait fear} effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime they gain the {@condition frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
mid.name: Bravery

entries: The captain makes two {@action Strike||Strikes}, one with their rapier and one with their main-gauche (in either order). If both {@action Strike||Strikes} hit, the ship captain can attempt to {@action Disarm} the target. Their multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.
bot.name: Dual Disarm

entries: The captain orders their shipmates to fight without mercy. All allied creatures of equal or lower level within 20 feet of the ship captain gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the ship captain's next turn.
bot.name: No Quarter!

entries: The smith deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage when they hit with a weapon they created.
bot.name: Smith's Fury

entries: The spy has positioned themself to seem a trusted ally, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to {@action Gather Information} or to {@action Make an Impression} among the nobles of that court.
top.name: Noble's Ally

entries: The spy draws a weapon and then {@action Strike||Strikes} with it. The target of the {@action Strike} is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack.
bot.name: Hidden Blade

entries: The spy deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: When the surgeon rolls a critical failure on a check to {@action Treat Disease}, {@action Treat Poison}, or {@action Treat Wounds}, they get a failure instead.
top.name: Doctor's Hand

entries: The surgeon attempts a {@skill Medicine} check against the Fortitude DC of one living creature they can see within 60 feet. On a success, the surgeon's melee {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage against that creature ({@dice 2d6} on a critical success) until 1 minute passes or the surgeon critically hits that creature, whichever comes first. Using this action again designates a new target and ends the effect for any previous target. A surgeon can target an individual creature no more than once per day with this ability.
bot.name: Medical Malpractice

creature.name: Tax Collector
items: collection of expired documents with intact seals
padded armor, tax documents in scroll case.

entries: The tax collector {@action Stride||Strides}. At any point during this movement, they can {@action Interact} to hurl coins. If there are commoners about, this typically causes a scene. Crowds are usually {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and have other effects (Core Rulebook 514).
bot.name: Glittering Distraction

entries: The teacher can attempt to {@action Recall Knowledge} on any general subject with a +10 modifier.
top.name: Font of Knowledge

entries: 50 feet. Any of the teacher's students in the aura gains a +1 circumstance bonus to {@action Recall Knowledge}.
top.name: Inspirational Presence

entries: The tomb raider automatically attempts a secret {@skill Perception} check to notice a hazard when they are within 10 feet of the hazard.
top.name: Hazard Spotter

entries: The tomb raider musters their guile to attempt a clever attack that catches their foe unprepared. The tomb raider chooses one of their weapons. The next attack with that weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage. In addition, the tomb raider can {@action Interact} to draw the weapon (or to reload it if they choose the hand crossbow).
bot.name: Trick Attack

entries: A torchbearer is adept at attacking with {@item torch||torches} and deals 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} when they critically hit with a torch.
bot.name: Torch Combatant

entries: As poacher, but the tracker feeds 16 additional creatures, or 32 on a critical success.
top.name: Forager
entries_as_xyz: While using {@skill Survival} to {@action Subsist}, if the hunter rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the hunter rolls a success, they can provide food for 4 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 8 creatures on a critical success.

entries: The tracker can {@action Track} while moving at full speed.
top.name: Master Tracker

entries: As poacher (page 218).
bot.name: Hunt Prey

entries: The troubadour can {@action Recall Knowledge} on any subject with a +7 modifier.
top.name: Bardic Lore

entries: The urchin gains a +1 circumstance bonus to {@action Steal} or {@action Palm an Object} while within 10 feet of an ally who has the pickpocket ability.
bot.name: Collaborative Thievery

entries: The urchin can {@action Steal} or {@action Palm an Object} that's closely guarded without taking the usual –5 penalty. They can {@action Steal} objects that would be extremely noticeable or time-consuming to remove (like worn shoes, armor, or actively wielded objects).
bot.name: Pickpocket

mid.trigger: One of the warden's enemies within 100 feet attacks one of the warden's allies or a person the warden is sworn to protect
entries: The warden {@action Strike||Strikes} the triggering enemy. If the {@action Strike} hits, the enemy's attack is deflected, reducing its damage by 8, or by 16 if the warden's {@action Strike} was a critical hit.
mid.name: Warding Strike

entries: A warden deals an extra {@dice 1d8} damage to any creature trespassing on the territory the warden protects.
bot.name: Warden's Protection

entries: 10 feet. Creatures in the aura who are the same or lower level than the watch officer take a –2 status penalty to their Will DC against the watch officer's attempts to {@action Coerce} or {@action Demoralize} them.
mid.name: Air of Authority

entries: When the captain of the guard rolls a success on a Will save against a {@trait fear} effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the {@condition frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
mid.name: Bravery

entries: The watch officer {@action Stride||Strides} twice. If they end their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee {@action Strike} against that enemy.
bot.name: Sudden Charge

mid.trigger: A creature the zealot can see damages a follower of Asmodeus other than the zealot
entries: The zealot gains the effect of a 1st-level {@spell true strike} spell. If the zealot makes an attack roll against anyone other than the triggering creature, the true strike ends with no effect.
mid.name: Swear Vengeance

entries: The zealot expends a prepared {@spell harm} spell and makes a melee {@action Strike}. Instead of the normal effect of the spell, its negative damage is added to the {@action Strike}'s damage.
bot.name: Channel Smite

entries: The zealot's mace deals {@dice 1d8} damage instead of {@dice 1d6}.
bot.name: Deadly Simplicity
